alert.note: Alert for Scott (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 13 at 8:26PM CDT until April 13 at 8:45PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CDT FOR NORTHERN JASPER...NEWTON AND SOUTHEASTERN SCOTT COUNTIES... At 826 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Lawrence, or 7 miles west of Newton, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... Newton and Garlandville around 835 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Chunky, Lake and Hickory. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
